title: Riverheads dominates Page County
text:
Bill Meade 2:54 p.m. EDT October 17, 2015 Robson 237 CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
GREENVILLE — With one long scoring play after another, Riverheads enjoyed homecoming over Page County 73-30, scoring 63 points in the first half alone. 
The win propelled the Gladiators to 7-0 on the season with three district games remaining. 
Scoring five times in the first period and another four times in the second, the Red Pride raced out to a 63-22 lead at intermission. 
After Landon Diehl scored on a 60-yard TD run, Page closed to within 7-6 on a 50-yard scoring run by quarterback William Hart. 
That was as close as the Panthers would get as the Gladiators ran through gaping holes all night. 
Also scoring in the first quarter was Colton Miller on a 53-yard score, Harrison Schaefer on a 36-yard run, Ridge Stokes on a 36-yard pass from Garrett Campbell and a nine-yard run by Diehl. 
In the second quarter, as the Red Pride continued to chew up yardage, Schaefer scored on a 24-yard run, Jackson Shover on a 29-yard run, and Jeffrey Maddox on runs of six and 65 yards. 
The Panthers scored twice more on passes from Hart to Tylor Williams. 
Tristan Robson, who converted 10 straight extra points, added a 27-yard field goal in the third quarter and Shover scored again from 42 yards out. 
The Panthers (1-6) added a late touchdown on a three-yard run to complete the 103 total points. 
Riverheads amassed a total of 468 yards, with 423 coming on the ground. 
The Gladiators’ senior Brandon Heizer appeared to suffer a broken leg in the third quarter and was transported to Augusta Medical Center. 
Riverheads travels to county rival Wilson Memorial next Friday. 
PAGE COUNTY 6 16 0 8 — 30 
RIVERHEADS 35 28 10 0 — 73
